alert.note: Alert for Butler; Montgomery; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 1:45PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BUTLER, NORTHWESTERN WARREN AND SOUTH CENTRAL MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM EST... At 145 PM EST, a strong thunderstorm was located near Ross, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Oxford, Miamisburg, Lebanon, Springboro, Monroe, Trenton, Franklin, Carlisle, South Middletown, Ross, Seven Mile, Williamsdale, Four Bridges, Hunter, Wetherington and Darrtown. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 28 and 33. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 23 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
